flutter.translation[0].definitions[0].de: if a bird or insect flutters, or if it flutters its wings, it flies by moving its wings lightly up and down
flutter.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: A small bird fluttered past the window.
flutter.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to make small gentle movements in the air
flutter.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Dead leaves fluttered slowly to the ground.
The flag fluttered in the light breeze.
flutter.translation[0].definitions[2].de: if your heart or your stomach flutters, you feel very excited or nervous
flutter.translation[0].definitions[3].de: if your eyelids flutter, they move slightly when you are asleep
flutter.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Her eyelids fluttered but did not open.
flutter.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a feeling of being nervous, confused, or excited
flutter.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: His sudden resignation caused quite a flutter.
She was all in a flutter.
flutter.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to risk a small amount of money on the result of a horse race, football game etc
flutter.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: Lots of people like to have a flutter on the lottery.
